page.title: 20ELEGY IN A LECHLADE FIELD
page.content: How long have you been lying there? How did you die? Were you burnt for witchcraft through a jealous neighbour's lie? Were you a human sacrifice? Buried with a king? Can you still hear, in rotting ears, your mourning parents cry? They must have been so tearful when they realised you had died. Do you still worship Tiw the God? Does he protect you still? You lie there in your stony bed, What thoughts run through your mind? Do you think of life or death, of evil work or kind? How old were you when you were killed? Were you still a child? Did you die through child-birth, or were you thirty five? What do you think of being handled? Poked and prodded then dismantled. How do you feel about being disturbed? Are you pleased or just perturbed? Stephanie Pitts Age 11
